Also, Seeker_B ranks Company_A as their #1, so rejecting risks losing a willing match, but accepting now could block a better match with E/D. Given the market info: Seeker_E prefers Company_C then D then A; Seeker_D prefers B then C then A—both might not come to A first, but could if rejected elsewhere. Therefore, reject now to preserve optionality for higher-priority candidates.
